website_summaries.verdict: This ice axe leash is adjustable to fit almost any height, and you can handle it reasonably well even when wearing gloves.
pros: Compatible with any technical ice tool or mountaineering axe.Lightweight webbing
Sliding metal barrel cinches wrist loop
Slider buckle lets you adjust to ideal arm length
Manageable even when wearing large gloves
cons: Slider is a little stiff at first
There's a lot of slack on the leash

customer_reviews.title: Good and long!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Held my weight when I self arrested and slipped my grip on the handle! The only thing - I'm not sure what kind of ice ax other people use, but damn, there is a LOT of slack on the leash. I had to cut just about half off in order to not have tons bunched up or hanging! The cinch I was initially worried as first, since it's thin metal, but it seems to hold up fine, and not move as much as I was expecting it to.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Potential life saver
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's a little extra weight, but you know what's worse than a few ounces? Watching your $200 ice axe slide down into a crevasse. Use a leash.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: My team called me a Streisand ticket-holding friend of Dorothy.
customer_reviews.text: This leash is pretty cool. It does the job nicely. It was a bit awkward to pull off my gloves while changing hands at first, but I liked having my axe so securely tethered. But kids, I gotta warn ya. If your macho team of alpine brutes sees you blundering with this fluff, they might think you've been reading too much Oscar Wilde. Real men use plain old hand tied slings. Now I know.
customer_reviews.author: BarneyCrackle

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: Fit my black diamon ice axe and works well. I thought it was gonna be big and in the way but I really didn’t notice it at all
customer_reviews.author: GraysonT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Great Leash. Goes on easy. Been using it for 2 seasons here in Colorado and it's performed well. Saved my ax from falling a couple times as well. Would recomment.
customer_reviews.author: Vioxx

customer_reviews.title: Strong and well constructed
customer_reviews.text: Would I trust my life with this leash? I have and will continue to. My only gripe is the slider is a little stiff. Maybe it will slide more smoothly as the leash breaks in. The wrist pad is smooth and feels very secure. In self arrest situations I have never had problems of the leash getting in the way or causing me any distraction.
customer_reviews.author: CabinFever

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. The adjuster at the wrist works great and ...
customer_reviews.text: You can choose how long it is. Perfect. The adjuster at the wrist works great and doable with big gloves on.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to have an axe you must have something. This seems to do the job thru heavy use. Shipped as agreed and was easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: WillZ

customer_reviews.title: Black Diamond Slider Ice Axe Leash
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product but I was a little concerned that the ring that is used to cinch the wrist strap up slips a little. This could result in dropping the axe if you're not careful. I used it on Mt. Rainier and was careful and it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Nice leash
customer_reviews.text: Nice and comfortable leash for Black Diamond ice axe. However you can use it for any ice axe.
customer_reviews.author: Olexii

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Black Diamond Slider Leash
customer_reviews.text: The item I purchased was of high quality and indeed one size fits all! I know that the recipient will now be safe every time he climbs with his ice axe!
customer_reviews.author: AV1422

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to your ice axe.
customer_reviews.text: I used the leash on my latest trip hiking and skiing Tuckerman's Ravine in New Hampshire. It added an extra level of security that was nice.
customer_reviews.author: skisilly

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Great for what it is, except that switching hands is a hassle if you're zig zagging up a hill. I tend to go straight though. While I gave this 5 stars, at this point I'd recommend just pulling some utility cord through the axe and attaching it to your harness/backpack instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mirza

customer_reviews.title: excellent leash
customer_reviews.text: Really good leash. I installed it right away on my husband's BD ice axe. It's long enough to fit a long ice axe easily as well. The instruction manual was easy to read; I really like the product.
customer_reviews.author: ebellata

product_meta.title: Black Diamond Slider Leash
product_meta.description: The Black Diamond Slider Leash's simple, functional design has made it the mountaineering standard among many climbers. Attach the Slider Leash to the head of any mountaineering axe, cinch down the sliding wrist cinch, and head for the summit.
feature_bullets: Compatible with any technical ice tool or mountaineering axe
Lightweight webbing leash with sliding metal barrel to Cinch wrist loop
